head.supplied: Melbourne botanic Garden, ¶ 27. May 1862. ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of your letter, dated 26 May, and beg in reply to inform you, that I shall be happy to place such plant...

div.p: Unit 731, VPRS 3181/P Town Clerk's file series 1, VA 511 Melbourne, Public Record Office, Victoria.

I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of your letter, dated 26 May, and beg in reply to inform you, that I shall be happy to place such plants at Mr Hyndman's disposal for the Municipality ground, as I have available at this establishment for this years distribution.

Already extensive supplies having been obtained this season I beg to suggest, that Mr Hyndman should receive the plants which he desires within the next days, since by the numerous applications the supply of available plants will be soon exhausted
Mr Hyndman will find me ready to attend to his requirements any morning at 9.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be,
